question_text: Where should the sentence "He spent most of his nights thinking about the exam" be placed in the paragraph?
instruction:
The five sentences below are not in the correct order to form a paragraph. 
Read the sentences carefully and then answer the questions that follow.
1. He smiled when he saw the paper.
2. He got up very early to go to school.
3. Teon	did not	sleep well for the past	week.
4. Teon packed his school bag and anxiously left.
5. He spent most of his	nights thinking	about the exam.

question_text: Suzie and June are

context.content:
Even	though	they	were	sisters,	Suzie	and	June	were	not	alike.		If	Suzie	wanted	
to	jump	rope,	June	wanted	to	play	hopscotch.		If	June	wanted	to	watch	a	movie,	
Suzie	wanted	to	watch	the	news.		Tensions	rose	to	the	point	that	the	girls	began	
to	dislike	each	other’s	company	but	things	changed	the	day	their	reports	came	
out.		Suzie	did	great	in	Science	but	failed	Mathematics	and	June	failed	Reading	
but	did	well	in	Social	Studies.		While	riding	the	bus	from	school,	the	girls	noticed	
that	they	were	both	upset.		After	talking,	they	realized	that	they	both	failed	a	
subject.	
Since	both	girls	wanted	to	pass	their	subjects,	they	agreed	to	help	each	other.		
So,	every	day	after	school	for	the	next	few	weeks,	Suzie	helped	June	with	
Reading	and	June	helped	Suzie	with	Mathematics.		By	the	time	the	next	report	
cards	were	distributed,	Suzie	and	June	were	passing	all	the	subjects.		The	girls	
were	delighted	but	their	mother	was	the	happiest	of	all.		Not	just	because	her	
daughters	passed	the	subjects	but	because	they	had	learnt	to	be	good	sisters.

Adapted from Theme Worksheet 2, n.d. Retrieved from https://www.ereadingworksheets.com/
reading-worksheets/theme-worksheet-02/preview/theme-worksheet-02-01.jpg
